intro: Valeriana tripteris subsp. tripteris, commonly known as the three-winged valerian, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has aromatic leaves and is often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties. The subspecies tripteris is distinguished by its three-winged fruits, which are a key identifying feature.
